/hr/registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicharts-m.title: metallb helm release
/hr/registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicharts-m.name: metallb

0:
address-pools:
- name: default
  protocol: layer2
  addresses:
  - 192.168.4.100-192.168.4.128

/hr/registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicharts-m.doc: metallb is a load-balancer implementation for Kubernetes, allowing you to create services with type: LoadBalancer. With BGP, you can setup IP ranges in your network that get assigned to k8s services. You can use IP addresses that are assigned to you, and share them amongst services.

0:
---
directory: /media/music
library: /data/library.db
import:
  move: true
  from_scratch: true
asciify_paths: true
group_albums: true
per_disc_numbering: true
paths:
  default: "$albumartist/[%if{$year,$year,0000}] $album%aunique{}/%if{$multidisc,$disc-}$track - $title"
  albumtype:soundtrack: "000-soundtracks/$album [%if{$year,$year,0000}]%aunique{}/%if{$multidisc,$disc-}$track - $title"
  comp: "000-compilations/$album [%if{$year,$year,0000}]%aunique{}/%if{$multidisc,$disc-}$track - %if{$artist,$artist - }$title"
  singleton: "000-non-album/$artist/$title"
plugins:
  - albumtypes # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/albumtypes.html
  - discogs # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/discogs.html
  - duplicates # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en//stable/plugins/duplicates.html
  - extrafiles # https://github.com/Holzhaus/beets-extrafiles
  - fetchart # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/fetchart.html
  - ftintitle # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/ftintitle.html
  - inline # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/inline.html
  - lastgenre # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/lastgenre.html
  - lyrics # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/lyrics.html
  - missing # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/missing.html
  - mbsync # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/mbsync.html
  - scrub # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/scrub.html
  - web # https://beets.readthedocs.io/en/stable/plugins/web.html
discogs:
  source_weight: 0.0
extrafiles:
  patterns:
      all:
        - '*.*'
fetchart:
  cautious: true
  sources: itunes *
item_fields:
  multidisc: 1 if disctotal > 1 else 0
lastgenre:
  canonical: yes
lyrics:
  fallback: ''
  synced: true
fuzzy:
web:
  reverse_proxy: true
  host: 0.0.0.0

1:
echo "Checking database connectivity..."
until nc -zv cnpg-mastodon-rw.productivity.svc.cluster.local 5432; do
  echo "Database is not ready yet. Retrying in 5 seconds..."
  sleep 5
done
echo "Database is ready. Proceeding with startup."

/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-exte.title: external-dns helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-exte.name: external-dns
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-helm-app-template-exte.doc: ExternalDNS is a Kubernetes add-on that automatically manages the creation and updates of DNS records for services running in your cluster. It integrates with a variety of DNS providers, such as CloudFlare DNS, Amazon Route 53, Google Cloud DNS, and more, to ensure that your applications are easily accessible from anywhere with a DNS name. With ExternalDNS, you can simplify the process of managing DNS records for your home lab, eliminating the need for manual updates and reducing the risk of errors.
